remarks: An ordered pair of sets is a set.  This is a special case of ~ opexg and new proofs should use ~ opexg instead.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 19-Sep-2018.)  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  TODO: replace its uses by uses of ~ opexg and then remove it.
statement: opexgOLD $p |- ( ( A e. _V /\ B e. _V ) -> <. A , B >. e. _V ) $.
